intro: Anil tribuloides, commonly known as the Indian cumin or wild cumin, is an annual herbaceous plant native to southern and eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its seeds, which are small and aromatic, are used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some cuisines. Anil tribuloides thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
